title: Cursive Fonts Look familiar but unable to remember the correct font face name
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415201843im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Gillian_4514.jpg)

Hello,

Please advice the fonts.

for the Alphabet G & the word team suggestions are welcomed.

Thanks.  
Regards,  
Hasnain

Font: 

 Filmotype Honey 

Solved By: 

 [Renko](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415201843/http:/typophile.com/user/12000 "View user profile.")
author: hasnain125

comments.content:
»illian« is a terribly kerned [Filmotype Honey](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415201843/http:/www.identifont.com/show?26IN), by Mark Simonson.

The G could be a manually adapted [Peignot](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415201843/http:/www.identifont.com/show?GNN) by Adolphe Mouron Cassandre.

"TEAM" looks like **[Edmondsans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415201843/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=LostType%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Edmondsans%20-%20Regular&fid=12cc1fc37fc2f0a97ab4360efa4994f2&fsize=60&text=TEAM&wrap=2)** by James T. Edmondson [2012] available from LostType

Thanks Renko and Fvilanakis for your advises.

I did have the Edmondsans but you have confirmed them.
